title: [2.4.3] Compiling with "-Ywarn-unused-import" warns when using Json.reads macro
body:
Currently the `Json.reads` macro injects unused imports into the AST and this produces compiler warnings when checking for unused imports (the `Json.format` macro does not, while it shares its implementation)
### Play Version (2.4.3)
### API (Scala)
### JDK (Oracle 1.8.0_92)

Linux ********\* 4.5.2-tuxonice #5 SMP Sat Apr 30 23:46:32 CEST 2016 x86_64 Intel(R) Xeon(R) CPU E3-1505M v5 @ 2.80GHz GenuineIntel GNU/Linux
### Expected Behavior
1. Create a Reads using `Json.reads[Foo]`
2. Have code compile without warning
### Actual Behavior
1. Create a Reads using `Json.reads[Foo]`
2. Have code compile with warnings:

```
[warn] /path/to/file.scala:1: Unused import
[warn] package first.line.in.file
```
### Reproducible Test Case

Create a project using the following two files and run `sbt compile`

`build.sbt`

```
scalaVersion := "2.11.8"                                                                                               
scalacOptions := Seq("-Ywarn-unused-import")                                                                           

libraryDependencies += "com.typesafe.play" %% "play-json" % "2.4.3"
```

`src/main/scala/Test.scala`

```
package first.line.in.file                                                                                             

import play.api.libs.json.Json                                                                                         

object Test {                                                                                                          
  case class Foo(bar: String)

  val reads = Json.reads[Foo]
}
```
